entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 AM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of up to 8 inches. * WHERE...In Oregon, Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon. In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northwest Blue Mountains

entry.title: Freezing Fog Advisory issued January 03 at 11:49PM PST until January 04 at 8:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Visibility as low as one quarter mile in freezing fog. * WHERE...Kittitas Valley. * WHEN...Until 8 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and potential frost on bridges.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kittitas Valley

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued January 04 at 1:28AM MST until January 04 at 12:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST /1 PM CST/ TODAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern, south central and southwestern South Dakota and northeast Wyoming. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Pine Ridge Reservation and the Rosebud
